712716f-a.title: Manhattan: 41st Street - 3rd Avenue
712716f-a.text:

to the East River. Note Tudor City in the background.

712717f-a.title: Manhattan: 41st Street - 3rd Avenue
712717f-a.text:
E. 41st Street, east from Third Avenue (foreground) to the East Riwer as seen from the 12th Floor of an office building or Jexington Avenue between 40th and 41st Streets. Note that at this date only one unit of Tudor City stands, same being the 42nc 43rd Street buildinm. Subsequently several others will rise and that latter date will see the huge News Pldg. in the left foreground.
August 30, 1927.
P.L. Sperr

712719f-a.title: Manhattan: 41st Street - 3rd Avenue
712719f-a.text:
216 East 41st Street, south side, east of Third Avenue. This is a two-story frame house with a stucco front.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 538
